Name: Living Composter
Description: Composting has never looked so chic! Minimalist and modern, this model is perfect for a busy household — it can process more than two pounds of food a week.

Name: Funny Produce Bags
Description: These reusable produce bags actually keep your fruits fresh for longer than the single use plastic ones the store supplies — just subtract the bag's weight as you check out.

Name: Reusable Bowl Covers
Description: No need to dirty plastic containers or throw your leftovers out — these breathable cloth covers will preserve everything from fruit salad to bread dough.

Name: Stainless Steel Water Bottle
Description: This pretty S'well water bottle not only sidesteps the need for single-use plastic water bottles, it also keeps your drink cold for up to 24 hours.

Name: Cork Yoga Mat
Description: Unlike typical yoga mats, cork mats are made of oak tree bark, which grows back when harvested sustainably — making this a great gift for an eco-minded yogi.

Name: BPA-Free Fire Truck
Description: Can you believe that this fire truck is made completely from recycled plastic milk containers? Neither will the kids who get to play with it.

Name: Solar-Powered Phone Charger
Description: This wireless, solar-powered charger also features a compass and flashlight, making it a must-have for any camping trip.

Name: Thermal Travel Mug
Description: This porcelain cup holds 16 ounces of liquid, and yes, you can fill it up at Starbucks (they'll even give you a discount for your sustainable efforts).

Name: Reusable Sandwich Bags
Description: These dishwasher-safe bags come in a ton of fun colors and patterns.

Name: Daytripper Tote
Description: Grocery shopping has never looked so cute! This blue-and-black  gingham bag is extra roomy so it can hold a big grocery haul, but it folds flat for easy storage.

Name: Better Sweater Jacket
Description: This jacket is a little pricier than some of the other items on this list, but that's because in addition to the Fair Trade Certified company's use of sustainable materials, it comes with a lifetime warranty.

Name: Beeswax Lip Balm
Description: The perfect stocking stuffer, this lip balm was awarded a Good Housekeeping Sustainable Packaging Award in 2019, thanks to the company's recycling program with TerraCycle.

Name: EcoFlow® Hand Held Shower Head
Description: Why not get yourself a gift while you're at it? A low-flow shower head like this one can seriously cut down on your water consumption.

Name: Compost Bin
Description: A little composting bin like this one makes it easy for anyone to get into minimizing the amount of garbage they send to the landfill.

Name: Stainless Steel Straws
Description: Water, iced coffee, sweet tea — whatever their drink of choice is, they can drink it with a metal straw. Plus, this set comes with a nifty cleaning tool.

Name: Decomposition Book
Description: Journaling is good for you, and with a notebook made out of post-consumer-waste recycled paper, it's good for the earth too.

Name: Shea Butter Hand Cream
Description: Another 2019 Good Housekeeping Sustainable Packaging Award winner, this rich, shea butter formula comes in an aluminum tube that's fully recyclable.

Name: Recycled Polyester Touch Screen Gloves
Description: You'll never believe that these soft, knit gloves from Asos are made out of plastic bottles and textile waste (and that you can text while wearing them!).

Name: Recycled Materials Padded Headband
Description: Headbands are back in a big way, but the fashionista in your life probably already knows that. The knot-front in this Asos headband is actually made from recycled polyester.

Name: Hand Cream
Description: This thick had cream will fight winter dryness. Plus, the zero-waste company takes back all packing of their products, as well as other brands products, that can't be recycled at locally.

Name: The Farmstand Hydroponic Garden
Description: Zooey Deschanel co-founded Lettuce Grow, which makes the Farmstand, a vertical hydroponic garden (meaning all these plants need is water!) that’s ideal for small spaces. Grow your own kale, lettuce, berries, cilantro, tomatoes — you name it, you can most likely grow it — literally on your porch or right outside your apartment. Choose what you want from Lettuce Grow’s seedling collection and get it all delivered to you. From there, you only need to spend 5 minutes a week tending to your garden, and in about 3 weeks, you’ll have fresh produce right from your own backyard (or porch/deck/balcony). Traditional gardens need up to 20 gallons of water to be tended to, whereas the farmstand only need 1 gallon. Plus, you’ll get your bounty in a matter of weeks, or you get your money back. There’s a reason why everyone is obsessed with this new eco-consious way of growing their own food!

Name: Bite Beauty Agave+ Daytime Vegan Lip Balm
Description: Bite Beauty lovers can attest that all of their products are uh-mazing, regardless of whether you need a good lip balm, lipstick, or foundation. It’s made with clean, vegan ingredients (there are no Sulfates SLS and SLES, parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, triclosan, triclocarban), this lip balm is our tried-and-true favorite when it comes to balm that’ll truly hydrate your chapped lips. It also smells fantastic (like an orangesicle!).

Name: Solar Power Bank & Portable Charger
Description: Save energy by going solar! This solar power bank and wireless, portable charger charges iPhones and Androids, and even comes with a flashlight and compass kit. If you’re an avid camper or just find yourself needing to charge your phone *all* the time, this is a super smart solution.

Name: Mad Hippie Skin Care Exfoliating Serum
Description: Looking for an eco-friendly serum that’ll help exfoliate your skin and leave it super soft and bright the next morning? Look no further! Normally sold at Whole Foods, Mad Hippie is the MVP of green grocery store beauty. Our shopping editor swears by Mad Hippie exfoliating serum, especially in the winter time when her skin gets dry and dull. She’ll usually use this nightly (it’s gentle enough) with a moisturizer and sees instant results. It’s all natural, cruelty-free, vegan, and GMO-free and uses earth’s ingredients like gigawhite, and apple stem cells to get the job done. Its 10% alpha hydroxy acid formula will leave your skin a little tingly, but don’t worry — that’s totally normal.

Name: Reusable Glass Straws Set
Description: This fun, multicolored glass straw set of 8 comes with two straw cleaners, so no more leftover seeds and pulp after your morning smoothie! These are handmade lead- free, BPA free, and non-toxic. Goodbye, plastic straws forever!

Name: Biodegradable Hair Ties in Rainbow by KOOSHOO
Description: It’s the little things in life that friends and family would never think to buy for themselves. These plastic-free hair ties are a lifesaver (and we don’t say that lightly). While the ties that you snag from the drugstore are typically made from plastic, these are made with GOTS certified organic cotton and natural rubber. Available in a slew of colorways including rainbow or neutral, they’re super cute and easy to coordinate with a variety of looks (whether you wear them on your wrist or in a ponytail). The name itself, KOOSHOO translates to “feeling good.” From yoga class to running errands, you’ll never have to worry about not having a spare hair tie to keep your ish together. Side note: These make great stocking stuffers!

Name: Nordic By Nature Reusable Sandwich Bags (4 Pack)
Description: Lunch break just got cuter thanks to Nordic By Nature’s reusable patterned sandwich bags. Whether you’re packing a sandwich, animal crackers, veggies, or fruit, these cute cotton pouches will eliminate the need for disposable plastic bags. For the mom with grade school kiddos, this is game-changing news. Even if they’re doing homeschooling this term, lunch is still going to be a vital part of their day. Each set contains four sizes (medium, small, and two extra-large), so convenience is a big factor. The bags are non-toxic, phthalate-free, lead-free, and BPA-free—not to mention dishwasher safe and easy to clean! We’re partial to the tropical green flower print but the green camo colorway is pretty rad, too.

Name: Reusable Zip Up Bags
Description: This colorful 3-piece reusable bag set comes in large, medium, and small — and we use it for everything, including leftovers, makeup, Midol-on-the-go, tampons, and more. We’ve also ran these bags through the dishwasher at least two dozen times by this point, and they’re still holding up.

Name: Plantable Coloring Pencils with Seeds
Description: You can channel all your adult coloring impulses with these lead-free pencils, and when you've used them up, you can "plant" them—there are seed capsules in the base of the pencil instead of an eraser. Each pencil has a marking of the seeds it contains and is biodegradable. If you don't have a green thumb, the packet also gives you directions on how to get the plants to grow and thrive.

Name: Adopt a Tiger
Description: There are a number of critical causes one can donate to these days, and it's worth making a donation in lieu of a gift. This does both: You can symbolically adopt an animal, and you get a stuffed toy in its honor. I currently have the fennec fox and have gifted out the hedgehog, so I can vouch that it's a crowd-pleaser. Bonus: The website includes a list of the endangered species WWF supports with simple, sweet explanations about the species' importance, and your gift comes with supplementary materials about your animal.

Name: Zero Waste Starter Kit: The Works
Description: Everything you could possibly need for going down the path to zero-waste is right here. Utensils and straws you can use instead of plastic. A reusable non-plastic water bottle. A net bag for your produce at the store. Bamboo toothbrushes. Beeswax food wraps for your perishables. This is particularly useful if you know someone who wants to be more sustainable, but has no idea where to start.

Name: ALVABABY Baby Cloth Diapers
Description: All aboard the struggle bus! You don’t have to be a new mom to know that babies go through a sh*tload of diapers. And as you know, diapers cannot be recycled… for obvious reasons. BUT, that’s where these reusable cloth diapers (pack of six) come in. Not only are they perfect for the cutie patootie in your life but just think how convenient they’ll be when out and about. Word on the street is that these modern cloth nappies are SUPER absorbent and comfortable for baby. They’re one-size-fits-all—simply adjust the diaper by snapping on the buttons for a precise fit. Says this mama, “All right, so I have been using cloth diapers since my son was born coming up on a year. I used newborn diapers for the first 2 months (Alva and Kawaii) and then I started using these. These were actually the very first pocket cloth diapers I ever got. These ended up being my favorite. They fit the best, I love the solid colors, and they are easy to customize.”

Name: Ethique Eco-Friendly Gingersnap Face Scrub
Description: You can't get much more natural than this, and who doesn't need/want/love a good face scrub? It only has 11 ingredients, including brown sugar and vanilla, and it's totally plant-based, plastic-free, and vegan. Even your strictest, most ethically minded friend will love it.

Name: Harris
Description: Warby Parker isn't just the biggest glasses trend (I have two pairs and counting)—they also use cellulose acetate, a renewable, plant-based material, to make many of their frames. They practice responsible sourcing and transparency, and they're a carbon-neutral company. Warby Parker also has a Buy a Pair, Give a Pair program to help those who need glasses but can't afford it. Plus, their styles are stylish and fun on top of all that, like these tortoise sunnies.

Name: Merkato Signature Tote
Description: Parker Clay is founded by a husband and wife duo that moved to Addis Ababa after adopting two Ethiopian girls. There, they saw the prevalence of human trafficking and prostitution amongst women, and launched this brand to create job opportunities and help them financially.  The leather is sourced from tanneries that recycle all the water used during the process and is dyed with all-natural, organic, vegetable-based dyes. Truly a purchase you can feel good about—and it's monogrammable.

Name: Comfort Stretch Ultra High Rise Stove Pipe
Description: Re/Done has a cool, creative solution to the denim problem in the fashion industry (which normally wastes a ton of water and uses harmful chemicals). Instead, Re/Done takes worn old jeans, deconstructs them, and uses the fabric to create new jeans. It's luxury fashion that's also sustainable. Their jeans include straight, flare, and even trendier trouser styles that'll still be totally wearable years down the road. Think of sustainable shopping as creating a really great long-term capsule wardrobe—and this as a perfect piece.

Name: Planter
Description: This could not be an easier plant to grow, even if you kill every green thing you touch, like myself. This planter can be hung from the ceiling or placed on a flat surface for a bright and modern addition to home decor. The planter doesn't include the air plant itself, but you can get one from the store—the plants get most of their nutrients from the air and are incredibly low-maintenance for when your gift recipient inevitably forgets to water them.

Name: Wireless Nimble for Good Travel Kit
Description: A charger made from plants? Who knew technology could be made from recycled bottles and plant-based bioplastics? So friggin’ cool! Nimble for Good makes wireless and portable chargers out of a mixture of recycled plastic bottles and hemp, so their products are totally eco-friendly and sustainable. The wireless travel kit includes a wireless pad and dual USB wall charger to charge two devices quickly and for longevity. It has built in cable management, so everything can be stored away in one compact box (just 4.41″ x 3.03″ x 0.6″), and it comes in plastic-free packaging. It’s compatible with newer iPhones, Samsungs, Androids, AirPods, and the Google Pixel 3. One happy customer says, “I love that this charging device is environmentally conscious and it meets all of my gadget obsessed needs doing so. I love the simple unique style and outstanding functionality. Nimble please keep up the outstanding work and the products coming.”

Name: Little Sun Diamond
Description: This pretty little light has big implications. It's solar-powered so it saves power, plus for every one sold, another is made available at a locally affordable price to an African community with limited access to electricity. Little Sun Diamond gives five hours of bright light for a five-hour charge and can be used with its stand or worn around the neck with the accompanying lanyard.

Name: Dyson Lightcycle Task Lamp
Description: The Dyson Lightcycle adjusts its glow to the room around it and whether or not anyone is present, ensuring that it's not wasting energy.

Name: Incipio Organicore
Description: Once they've moved on to a new model of phone and recycled their old one, they can toss this Incipio Organicore into the compost bin since it's plant-based.

Name: LARQ Self Cleaning Water Bottle
Description: Reusable water bottles are kinder to the Earth than disposable ones but can harbor not-so-friendly bacteria. LARQ uses a UV-C LED light to dispense with germs and keeps cold beverages cold for 24 hours and hot beverages hot for 12.

Name: Reusable Everyday Tote in Leopard
Description: By now, a tote is basically essential for heading out of the house to run errands. But I somehow manage to forget mine at home a good chunk of the time, mostly because they don't really feel like part of my wardrobe. Enter this pretty bag that's also monogrammable—I got my sister a similar personalized one when she moved to an urban area. I might just grab one too, since they're so cost-effective.

Name: Florence
Description: Lots of nail polish contains toxic chemicals, not to mention a whole bunch of plastic in the container. Not so with Sienna. Their polishes are free of nasty chemicals, vegan, and certified as cruelty-free by PETA. Their caps are made from sustainable timber, and their nail polish remover is made from soy and renewable sources. They also have an abundance of pretty colors, including this pretty, classic color you can wear year-round.

Name: Medium Backpack
Description: Opus Mind specializes in upcycling—it works with RecycLeather, a company that recycles leather fibers from leather waste, for a circular fashion model. It also specializes in classic styles like this backpack (which also comes in pink, orange, black, and olive) and isn't constantly debuting trends that come and go. Their goods are designed for a streamlined timelessness so that they can be worn over and over.

Name: Seiko Solar Watches
Description: Seiko solar watches rely on just a few hours of sun all year to run. They come in designs that suit a wide range of styles, like the Cartier-like timepiece for men and women.

Name: The Smart Garden 27
Description: Food can't get more local than picking it in your own living room. Smart Garden 27 can grow herbs, fruits, and vegetables and provides the perfect environment for them. Energy-efficient LED lighting and carefully calibrated water dispersal mean no resources are wasted.

Name: Plumen 001 LED
Description: The Plumen 001 LED bulb makes a design and an environmental statement. It should shine for 20,000 hours and look good for all of them.

Name: Ultimate Ears Hyperboom Speaker
Description: The Ultimate Ears Hyperboom has big sound but not a big footprint. It's made of post-consumer recycled plastics.

Name: Cozy Eco Friendly Slippers asdasdasd
Description:
As the northern hemisphere cozies up for winter and the holiday season kicks in, eco friendly slippers are everyone’s best friend. We practically live in ours!

If your loved one doesn’t have a pair of stylish, comfy house slippers, this one may be a winner of a gift – suitable for him, her and the kids.

Name: Snuggly Ethical Pajamas
Description: Another winter delight, dreamy pajamas can be a game changer. And what a thrill to know that there are so many options for fabulous ethical pajamas these days.

Name: Unique Artisan Gifts
Description: If you’re doing this year’s holiday shopping safely from home (as most of us are), you’ll want to reduce as much impact associated with online shopping as you can. And one sure way to do so is to support one of the many ethical online stores.

Name: Sustainable Jewelry
Description: What says, “I love you” better than a pair of dewdrop diamond earrings? A pair of dewdrops that have also been sustainable and ethically made, of course! Take a look at our list of sustainable jewelry brands for a full range of ideas at every price point.

Name: Sexy Lingerie
Description:
Socks have become somewhat of a cliche Christmas gift (though not necessarily an unwanted one if they’re eco friendly socks), so why not put a little spin on the holiday essentials by giving a pair of ethical underwear.

Underwear as a gift?! Are we serious?

As serious as silk (as long as it’s cruelty free, that is). 

Think about it: everyone (nudists aside) needs underwear and it’s usually the item we run out of first, forcing us to do laundry. So, giving more underwear will reduce the number of times they flip the switch on the washing machine.

Name: Stylish sustainable Sunglasses
Description: Escaping the cold and snow this holiday season for a vacay somewhere sunny? Then gift your loved one a new pair of sustainable sunglasses to sport while relaxing on the beach (just don’t forget the reef safe sunscreen, too!).

Name: Sustainable Beauty and Personal Care Products
Description:
For eco friendly loved ones that love ethical and sustainable cosmetics, a little care package of some select but ultra-impressive options would go down a treat.

Even if they’re not a makeup lover per se, most people would appreciate some basic personal care essentials like shampoo, deodorant, toothpaste, or some other useful care product.

Whenever we look for sustainable personal care products, we look for those that are non-toxic, cruelty free, vegan, palm oil-free products that have thoughtful packaging (ideally zero waste!).

Name: Eco Friendly Phone Cover
Description: Want to be sure your gift is going to do more good than harm? How about an eco friendly phone case?

Name: Eco Friendly Sneakers
Description: For a truly practical eco friendly gift, take a peek at your loved one’s shoe collection and see whether their runners are a bit, well, run out. If so, a new pair of ethical sneakers might be just what the personal trainer ordered

Name: Pima Cami
Description: Cuyana founders Karla Gallardo and Shilpa Shah are all about their Lean Closet program—fewer, better pieces that provide everything you need to make a small, but impactful wardrobe. They're also partnering with thredUP to expand their program, with free thredUP shipping labels so you can clean out your closet. The program also benefits H.E.A.R.T. (Helping Ease Abuse Related Trauma). This pima-modal blend cami is ubiquitous, comes in gray and black too, and is the exact kind of staple that you can wear everywhere. In other words, the price-per-wear is low, and your gift recipients can find a use for it in their daily lives.

Name: Tikuri Plunge Neck
Description: Supermodel Liya Kebede founded her brand when she took a trip to Ethiopia and met a group of traditional weavers—who no longer had a market for their goods. The brand means "to bloom and flourish" in the Ethiopian language of Amharic. Kebede explains, "By employing traditional weavers, we're trying to break their cycle of poverty, at the same time preserving the art of weaving while creating modern, casual, comfortable stuff that we really want to wear."

Name: Faro Dress
Description: This resort wear brand relies on artists and craftspeople in Lagos, Nigeria (which is also where the brand is based). Launched in 2018, Míe pieces are made from natural, biodegradable fabrics; They don't have hundreds of options (that's sort of the point—to have classic pieces, the slow fashion way), but each one is breathable and ideal for your next tropical getaway. They also have items that'll double as the perfect summer wardrobe‚ like this linen dress.

Name: Dense Floral Violet Blouse
Description: Fashion designer Tracy Reese implements strong social and ethical structures into her brand, allowing women to look and feel good while supporting worthy causes. Celebrities including Oprah, Sarah Jessica Parker, Tracee Ellis Ross, and even First Lady Michelle Obama have all worn her clothes. Her work is both chic and fun: Pair this buttoned-up blazer with trousers for work or distressed denim and heels for date night.

Name: The North Face Etip Recycled Tech Glove
Description: These North Face gloves keep hands warm, free to text, and are made of 93% recycled polyester.

Name: ToughTested Solar Charger
Description: The ToughTested Solar Charger can keep phones charged several times over using only the light of the sun.

Name: Smart Thermostat
Description: See technology at its finest with the Smart Thermostat, where you can adjust the temperature of your room without lifting a finger. With its smart sensors, it can automatically adjust the room’s temperature to a more adequate level, according to your habits and routines. Yes! It’s able to adapt to your schedule and routine. The future has never been brighter with the Smart Thermostat.

Name: Evaporative Air Cooler & Humidifier
Description: Enjoy the benefits of three humidifiers in one with the Evaporative Air Cooler and Humidifier. It will humidify, purify and chill the surrounding air at your temperature/humidity of choice. It is small and USB-powered, so it can sit perfectly on your desk, next to your bed or couch. Too loud? No problem, the Whisper-Quiet option allows you to lower its sound by adjusting the fan speed. Built with adjustable LED lights, this cooler will be a great addition to your living space.

Name: Cell Phone Cleaner
Description: For better or for worse, our phones are sticking with us. And, unless you're planning on washing your hands and face before and after each time you pick up your device, all that bacteria is sticking with you too. The Cell Phone Cleaner is a simple solution to keep harmful bacteria from spreading — not only from your phone to you but from you to others as well. If you live with anyone who may have a compromised immune system — young children, elderly or ill individuals —the device could be a particularly valuable investment.

Name: Reusable Notebook
Description: You can avoid a large number of notebooks stacked up or scattered everywhere in your office, or at home. What? One notebook isn’t enough? Well with the Reusable Notebook, you can have all your ideas, plans, to-dos, and schedules all in one place, and the best part is that you can easily wipe off your old writings and re-use the pages again. Don’t worry you can save all of your old notes using the app via your phone. The Reusable Notebook has just made your work easier.

Name: Pleat Pants
Description: Amour Vert (French for "Green Love") prioritizes brands that offer sustainable, stylish pieces. Kowtow is based out of New Zealand and works to make its garments sustainably and ethically with organic materials. We know Kate Middleton loves a good pair of culottes for everyday workwear, and this version offers a wide leg option that's comfortable and made out of 100 percent organic cotton (which is better than regular cotton in terms of sustainability).

Name: Rose Quartz Crystal Gemstone Eyeshadow Palette
Description: There are a number of makeup brands that are working to be sustainable, but Aether is something special: The palette is paper and fully recyclable, which they say is a first for the beauty industry. A mirror on a palette makes the whole thing unrecyclable, which is why Aether doesn't have one. One percent of sales go to The Water Project for water solutions in sub-Saharan Africa. ALSO—the colors are gorgeous, which means it's a joy to give (and receive).

Name: T-Shirts
Description: Eco tees? Yes please!

Name: The most comfortable Belt
Description: The stretchy belt gives you the perfect pant fit and they’re fully adjustable so you don’t have to worry about what size to give.

Name: Upcycled Home Slippers
Description: Artisan-made slippers using upcycled, recycled, and deadstock fabrics, for comfy and stylish days at home.

Name: Arts & Crafts Kids “Busy Box”
Description: Who isn’t looking for ways to occupy kids this year? This eco-friendly “busy box” from EarthHero is really a gift for both children and parents!

Name: Ocean Plastic Backpack
Description: Close the loop with a recycled GOT Bag.

Name: Wild-harvested Botanical Skincare
Description: For those who deserve some pampering, Sḵwálwen Botanicals creates “plant medicine for skin and spirit”

Name: Sock that Give Back
Description: These socks are so much more than your classic, useful gift!

Name: Cute & Quirky Bamboo Earrings & pins
Description: Adorable earrings, pins, and necklaces laser cut from sustainable bamboo and hand-painted.

Name: Build Anything Block Set
Description: Lovevery’s 70 piece block set offers endless possibilities for play, building motor-skills, exploration, and learning.

Name: Wooden Hair Sticks
Description: A unique and simple, yet beautiful way to hold and adorn hair

Name: hemp drawstring tea bags
Description: A pack of hemp drawstring tea bags that you can fill with your favourite blends. They're 100% biodegradable and come in recyclable packaging.

Name: menstrual cup
Description: A colourful menstrual cup that'll be your BFF when Aunt Flo rolls into town. You can wear it for up to 12 hours (depending on how heavy your flow is), so you'll never have to worry about forgetting to change a tampon or pad again.

Name: sponge cloths
Description: A set of sponge cloths made from wood pulp to clean up your messes without even touching paper towel. They can absorb about 15 times their weight in water, making them real saviours for cooking crises and wine spills.

Name: collapsible reusable mug
Description: A collapsible reusable mug that's made of recycled materials and is totally leakproof. It's smaller than a fist when folded up, so you can just pop in in your bag or glove compartment when it's not in use. Later days, single-use cups.

Name: Aveda Stress-Fix oil
Description: A bottle of all-natural Aveda Stress-Fix oil that you can use on your body and scalp. It'll soften your skin and is infused with lavender and clary sage to help chill you the heck out.

Name: glass drinking straws
Description: A set of glass drinking straws that'll give your morning juice or ice coffee a stylish upgrade. If you hate the metallic taste of stainless steel straws, these are an awesome alternative.

Name: ventilated compost bin
Description: A ventilated compost bin with a charcoal filter to keep odours trapped in. Now you won't be faced with gross smells if you forget to empty it for a night or two.

Name: organic bamboo rounds
Description: A pack of soft and sustainable organic bamboo rounds that'll replace your regular old cotton pads and make removing your makeup a breeze. They're machine washable, so you can just throw them in with the rest of your laundry when they get dirty.

Name: mesh bags
Description: A set of plastic-free mesh bags that you can use to carry and store your produce. Now you won't have to fumble around with the annoying filmy ones at the grocery store.

Name: biodegradable bullet vibrator
Description: A biodegradable bullet vibrator, so that even your orgasms are eco-friendly. Reviewers say it's a great option for beginners and gets the job done in no time.

Name: natural deodorant
Description: A stick of natural deodorant that's packed with coconut oil and plant-based ingredients that'll regulate sweat, neutralize odours, and banish nasty bacteria. It has a beach-inspired scent, which is a lot nicer than those artificial scents in drugstore deodorants.

Name: bubble food-saver lids
Description: A set of bubble food-saver lids that you can stretch over bowls to seal in flavour. It comes with four different sizes that fit everything from cans of beans to giant mixing bowls.

Name: utility suit
Description: A fashion-forward utility suit that’s made of organic cotton and TENCEL Lyocell cellulose fibres sourced from eco-friendly forests. Look at you, being all stylish AND saving the planet.

Name: cloth sandwich bags
Description: Or a set of cloth sandwich bags that are made out of recycled water bottles. They seal with zippers, so no morsels of food will sneak out.

Name: Stasher reusable silicone bag
Description: A Stasher reusable silicone bag that'll help you minimize plastic waste and keep your prepped snacks or ingredients in one place. They're leakproof and can be used in the freezer, microwave, and even the oven (up to 400 °F).

Name: stainless steel tumbler
Description: A stylish stainless steel tumbler that'll keep your cold drinks cold and your hot drinks hot. It may also inspire you to make your own coffee instead of having a barista do it for you.

Name: wooden cotton swabs
Description: A pack of wooden cotton swabs that are made of birch, so they're a lot easier on the environment. Time to kiss your regular Q-tips goodbye.

Name: wooden coffee maker
Description: A genius wooden coffee maker that'll craft you the perfect cuppa Joe without any filters. Using it is simple: just place it on top of your cup, add coffee grinds, pour hot water, and get to sippin'.

Name: eco shoe-protecting spray
Description: A bottle of eco shoe-protecting spray that'll repel dirt and stains from your precious kicks. The water-based formula is safe for leather, suede, nubuck, and fabric, so you can probably use it on most of your footwear.
